definitions.body: Damascus (As. Dimasûḳi, Dimasḳi, Dl:Pa 280 Schr:COT Ge 15:2 & ABK 323 Jäger:BAS ii. 281 f. Ar. dami4qu, dimi4qu; Aram. Targum Onk, etc. [[דמשק]], Ps-Jon [[דרמשק]]; darmsuuq)—[[דַּמֶּשֶׂק]] 1Ki 11:24 + 28 t.; [[דַּמָָּשֶׂק]] Ge 14:15 + 8 t.; [[דַּרְמֶשֶׂק]] 1Ch 18:5 + 3 t. ch; [[דַּרְמָָשֶׂק]] 2Ch 24:23, 2Ch 28:5; [[דּוּמֶּשֶׂק]] 2Ki 16:10; [[דְּמֶשֶׁק]] Am 3:12 v. foll., Vrss. [[דַּמֶּשֶׂק]];—ancient Aramaean city, situated lat. 33 deg. 30 min. N., long. 36 deg. 15 min. E., in plain E. of Hermon & SE. of Anti-Lebanon; on the Nahr Baradâ (Gk. Chrysorrhoas); mod. Dimishḳ & Esh-Sham, Rob:BR iii. 440 ff. Bd:Pal 307; Damascus Ge 14:15, Am 5:27, 1Ki 11:24, 1Ki 11:24, 2Ki 14:28, Ct So 7:5; so also prob. Ge 15:2 (perh. gloss cf. Di), (Am 3:12 v. foll.); a trading-centre Ez Eze 27:18; as capital & residence of king of Aram 1Ki 15:18 = 2Ch 16:2, cf. 1Ki 20:34, 2Ki 16:9, 2Ki 16:10, 2Ki 16:10, 2Ki 16:11, 2Ki 16:11, 2Ki 16:12, 2Ch 28:5, Is 7:8, Is 7:8, Is 8:4, Is 10:9 (cf. Peters:Hbr. April 1885, 242) Is 17:1, Is 17:1, Is 17:3, Je 49:23, Je 49:24, Je 49:27; including also surrounding territory Ez Eze 47:16, Eze 47:17 cf. v:Eze 47:18, Eze 48:1, v. ´[[מִדְבַּ֫רָה ד]] 1Ki 19:15; ´[[נַהֲרוֹת ד]] 2Ki 5:12; = kingdom Am 1:3, Am 1:5 cf. Zec 9:1; once (late) ´[[מֶלֶח ד]] 2Ch 24:23; note also ´[[אֲרַם ד]] 2Sa 8:5, 2Sa 8:6 = 1Ch 18:5, 1Ch 18:6; further ´[[אֱלֽהֵי ד]] 2Ch 28:23 (‖[[אֱלֽהֵי מַלְכֵי אֲרָם]]).
